snippet: The Yankees got six strong innings from Phil Hughes in a 7-2 victory against the Nationals, ending Washington’s winning streak at six while extending their own hot stretch to seven games.
abstract: New York Yankees defeat Washington Nationals, 7-2.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees got six strong innings from Phil Hughes in a 7-2 victory against the Nationals, ending Washington’s winning streak at six while extending their own hot stretch to seven games.

headline.seo: Hughes and Yankees Top Nationals in Interleague Matchup of Division Leaders
headline.main: Winning Streak Ends, but First-Place Yankees Make Sure It Isn’t Theirs
headline.print_headline: Winning Streak Ends, But First-Place Yanks Make Sure It Isn’t Theirs
